content.description: This is the triangular, fang-shaped boulder left of Ghost Rail. Try to climb every side of this unique feature! Climbing any side of the boulder is pretty much V0 however you do it. Be prepared for your downclimb though!
content.location: near the bluff under power lines

content.description: In the little hallway along the Pumpkin Boulder, look for a white-bird-poop-covered jug rail. Start here and climb up and to the right a little, on 2 small crimps. This is a pretty short climb, but fun.
content.location: east-facing side of the Pumpkin Boulder

content.description: An absolutely sublime slab climb. Perfect crimps and edges straight up a beautiful face.
content.location: In the cluster of boulders under the power lines, look for a south-facing (upstream-facing) slab, it has a rocky landing

content.description: Start low on the arete, climb up through some cool holds and then crank on that mono around the left side to the jug at the lip. 4 star classic warmup climb. V0+ with respect to all the V0+s in Hueco.
content.location: Southeast arete of the Pumpkin Boulder. A wonderful prominent arete with slight overhang at the top.

content.description: Excellent face climb, tall and spicy. Located on the shield-looking boulder kind of uphill from the Warmup Boulder, and to the left of the Ghost Rail. Look for a (now faded?) graffiti of an arrow, pointing left. Start just left of the graffiti.
content.location: A little uphill of the clearing under the powerlines. This boulder is close to the bluff but not attached to the bluff.

content.description: Great little problem on the left side of the Pumpkin Boulder. Start sitting on some crimp rails and follow a thin seam using crimps and the classic mono. Dyno off the mono or use some other small holds. Spicy and fun.
content.location: Left side of the south face of the Pumpkin Boulder, smack dab under the power lines.

content.description: Amazing overhung line that rides the left hand arete. Sit start on a block sticking out of the rock, follow the arete up and right til you bust straight up into the face. Some moves are very powerful, some require a lot of body tension. One of the first hard lines I spied when I visited Cline, wasn't sure if it was possible but after a lot of cleaning, this boulder has provided yet another mega problem. Welcome to the high desert. It's possible this has been climbed before, so I'll claim a first known ascent for this one.
content.protection: 3-4 pads, make sure to cover the block right underneath the climb well
content.location: on the backside of the Pumpkin Boulder (the side facing the river)

content.description: ..don't be afraid.Tall problem, one of the best in the area. Climbs the arete and face on the right. Big move going for a jug then crux moving above it.
content.protection: Couple extra pads to fill the hole. Easy to suss by TR from a tree above, just pad the cliff edge.
content.location: On the cliffband, just above the main cluster of boulders, in a little corridor leading to a meth den. Start with hands on a ledge on the cutout double-arete.

content.description: Climb the Ghost Rail, but instead of exiting off to the left on the ledge, continue straight up and use the rightside arete to top out the full line. The last section up high is not easy, climb with caution, could even be V6
content.location: On the bluff under the power lines, look for a flat landing under an arete. There was a dog-face-ghost-looking-ass graffiti on the face left of the arete, it may have faded by now. Climb the obvious crimp rail.

content.description: A great problem with some fun side pulls as you move left.
Another warmup climb. Climb the crack/seam on the Pumpkin Boulder left of the arete, using some jugs and crack holds. Beware the head-sized flake/block thing that might rip out at some point.
content.location: South face of the Pumpkin Boulder, follows obvious crack left of the arete and right of Hole in One

content.description: Climb the arete to the right of Left This Way. Pretty fun and gets you high off the deck
content.location: uphill on the shield-like boulder under the power lines

content.description: Start up on a small boulder to the left of the Hole in One and climb a faint arete/rib feature. I thought this climb would layback the arete the whole way, but once halfway up it makes more sense to just stand up left foot onto the slab and top out there. Not a bad warmup.
content.location: southwest corner of the Pumpkin Boulder

content.description: Climb up the middle of the east face of the Pumpkin Boulder, through a sidepull/undercling and other small holds. Start on the white-bird-poop jug rail (hence, right start) and traverse left along small holds to get to the holds that take you to the top.
content.location: East side of the Pumpkin Boulder in the little hallway

content.description: Climb up the middle of the east face of the Pumpkin Boulder, through a gaston/undercling and other small holds. Start on the arete (hence, left start) and traverse right along small holds to get to the holds that take you to the top.
content.location: East side of the Pumpkin Boulder in the little hallway

content.description: The central cluster of boulders under the powerlines, with a high density of boulders all within eyesight. It's a cool little spot to both warm up and also to hang out :) With classics like the Mono Arete, Ghost Rail, Hole in One, Left This Way, and one of the best slabs ever, you could spend the whole day here. The main boulder that you can walk all the way around (the obvious central boulder) is hereby known as the Pumpkin Boulder; it has about 10 climbs around all 360° of the bloc.
